definition: the act of changing location in an upward direction, get up and out of bed
details:
noun
- the act of changing location in an upward direction
= synonyms: ascent, ascension, ascending
- increase in price or value
= synonyms: advance
- the property possessed by a slope or surface that rises
= synonyms: upgrade, rising slope
- the amount a salary is increased
= synonyms: raise
- an increase in cost
= example: an increase in cost
= synonyms: hike
- a growth in strength or number or importance
- (theology) the origination of the Holy Spirit at Pentecost
= synonyms: procession
- a wave that lifts the surface of the water or ground
= synonyms: lift
- a movement upward
= example: a movement upward
= synonyms: rising, ascent, ascension
- an upward slope or grade (as in a road)
= example: an upward slope or grade (as in a road)
= synonyms: raise
verb
- get up and out of bed
= synonyms: get up, turn out, arise, uprise
- return from the dead
= example: return from the dead
= synonyms: uprise, resurrect
- increase in value or to a higher point
= synonyms: climb, go up
- rise in rank or status
= synonyms: jump
- become more extreme
= synonyms: heighten
- go up or advance
= synonyms: climb, mount, wax
- exert oneself to meet a challenge
= example: exert oneself to meet a challenge
- become heartened or elated
- move upward
= synonyms: lift
- move to a better position in life or to a better job
= synonyms: move up, ascend
- come up, of celestial bodies
= example: come up, of celestial bodies
= synonyms: uprise, ascend
- increase in volume
= synonyms: prove
- rise to one's feet
= synonyms: get up, arise, uprise, stand up
- come to the surface
= synonyms: surface, come up, rise up
- take part in a rebellion
= synonyms: rebel, arise, rise up
- come into existence
= synonyms: arise, uprise, develop, grow, become, originate, spring up
- rise up
= synonyms: lift
